message.content:
<<<api>>>: Set.iterator, Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public classB otherElement(classB argument){
    Iterator<classB> iterator = setElements.iterator();
    classB element1 = iterator.next();
    classB element2 = iterator.next();
    
    if(element1.equals(argument)){
        return element2;
    } else {
        return element1;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Set.iterator() method to get an iterator for the set. Then, you can use the Iterator.next() method to get the first and second elements of the set. Compare each element with the argument using the equals() method. If one element is equal to the argument, return the other element from the set.
